H0.text: What carries the blood flow of the human body from the periphery to the right side of the heart. Artery

H1.text: What carries the blood flow of the human body from the periphery to the right side of the heart. Capillary

H2.text: What carries the blood flow of the human body from the periphery to the right side of the heart. Lymphatic Vessel

H3.text: What carries the blood flow of the human body from the periphery to the right side of the heart. Vein

A4.text: In the systemic circulation, veins serve to return oxygen-depleted blood from organs, and tissues to the right heart.

A5.text: All of the systemic veins are tributaries of the largest veins, the superior and inferior vena cava, which empty the oxygen-depleted blood into the right atrium of the heart.
